title: 'Not at all worth for money'
body: It's the very worst Product that I have ever purchased. This exactly worked for 4 weeks and then stopped working. Even the charging cable was of not good quality.

title: 'Been using it for 2 years No problem yet. Only issuue is that it has no charge indicator.'
body: Great mouse works with good precision and the three modes helps a lot.  I have been using it for 2 years now no problem at all. It got out of my hand and dropped on hard surface too many times but it is quite sturdy and hasn't given any issue to me.  The ergonomic design does prove to be good for my hand, I work on PC almost 10+hrs a day thus the regular mouse was quite a pain in my hand but this design doeas help to not feel any stress in wrist.  There are major two issues that I feel annoyed with. 1. No charge indicator There is no software or hardware which will show you how much charge is left in the mouse. So you'll never no when your mouse is gonna give up on you. It has happened with me many time when there is urgent work on hand and this mouse just died with no warning. I have to keep record of it last full charging date to avoid such circumstances. The battery is quite good after using it extensively for two years and does give you great back up but you won't when it is going to die.  2. It requires rough surface to work on. I am not talking about glass or shiny surfaces like that, I know for working on glass I'll have to buy another one. But this mouse doesn't even work on solid flat surface. The surface need to have some king of roughness to get this mouse working properly, which could be annoying especially when you're not is your office or home. It doesn't even work on plain flat table surface.

title: 'Stopped working in 2 weeks'
body: Its comfortable to use if you get wrist pain but mine stopped working already. It started switching off when it was kept idle but now even after charging it doesn't work. Better to buy a good quality mouse.

title: There's no returning back to normal mice again!
body: This requires a bit of time to become comfortable with, especially with the left-clicks being aligned sideways. But once accustomed, maneuvering becomes very easy and feels really natural. There's no going back to the normal device for sure! Have to use it for a longer time to comment on the durability and battery life, but the initial impression is great.

body: I am so glad I bought this mouse. It's very comfortable, but takes a few hours to get used to if you've never used an ergonomic mouse before. It's very quiet when clicking the left click button, when clicking the middle scroll button it's slightly louder but still nothing like normal mice. The battery lasts me several weeks and I use it for at least 8 hours a day. The different speeds are also very noticeable and convenient.
